message_1: Let f(z) = z^3 - 4z^2 - z + 6 be an entire function. Find the number of zeroes of f(z) in the complex plane.
message_2: To find the number of zeroes of f(z) in the complex plane, we can use the Fundamental Theorem of Algebra, which states that a non-constant polynomial function has exactly as many zeroes as its degree, counting multiplicity. Since f(z) is a polynomial of degree 3, it has exactly 3 zeroes in the complex plane, counting multiplicity.
